content: Case assigned. Multiple red flags: VPN usage from Nigeria, deposits far exceed declared income, crypto transactions with obfuscated sources. Document flags on passport suggest possible AI-generated face. Prioritizing for immediate review.

Requested additional identity verification documents from customer. Email sent requesting: (1) Utility bill dated within last 90 days, (2) Secondary government-issued ID, (3) Bank statements for source of crypto deposits.
Account frozen pending customer response. Withdrawal capabilities disabled. Customer has 48 hours to respond to document request before escalation to compliance team.

Classic account takeover pattern. Customer has legitimate 6-month account history from London. Sudden login from Romania via proxy, followed by immediate cash-out attempts. Account already auto-frozen by system. Attempting to contact customer via registered phone.

Customer contact successful. She confirms she did NOT authorize any transactions after 08:45 GMT. Reports receiving phishing email yesterday that she may have clicked. Legitimate customer - likely phishing victim. Recommended password change and 2FA enablement.

OUTCOME: Confirmed fraud - Account takeover via phishing. Customer verified as legitimate victim. Reversed fraudulent transactions (TXN-88201, TXN-88202). Account unfrozen after password reset and 2FA setup. Blocklisted device DEV-ANDROID-5521 and IP 103.28.45.122.

Textbook structuring case. 12 deposits over 7 days, each just under $10K CTR threshold. Average amount $9,833. Customer owns a cash-heavy business (construction) which could explain cash deposits, but pattern is highly suspicious. Escalating to AML compliance team for SAR filing.
Requested business financial records: tax returns (2023-2024), business bank statements, customer lists, invoices for cash payments received. Also requested explanation for deposit pattern.
Low-risk alert. Single large transaction ($8,500) flagged as anomaly, but customer has 1+ year history with no issues. Transaction labeled as 'Employer Bonus Payment'. Reviewing for legitimacy.
Customer contacted. Confirmed she received annual performance bonus from employer. Provided copy of bonus letter and W-2 amendment. Transaction is legitimate.
OUTCOME: False positive. Legitimate employer bonus payment. No action required. Case closed.

Multiple critical alerts. Suspected money mule account. Brand new account (2 days old), disposable email, unverified KYC, rapid in-out flow ($12.4K in, $11.95K out in 24h), VPN from datacenter IP, device linked to 3 other suspicious accounts. High confidence this is a mule account.
Account immediately frozen. All outbound transactions blocked. Remaining balance ($450) held pending investigation. Flagged connected accounts (ACC-1122, ACC-5544, ACC-8899) for review.

Escalated to law enforcement liaison. Suspected organized fraud ring. Device DEV-ANDROID-9910 linked to 4 accounts created within 48 hours, all showing mule patterns. Requesting trace on crypto wallet 0xA8B...3f2 (source) and 0x9F1...cc8 (destination).
